job title: 2019 Summer IDP-Sales Data Analyst Intern (Carillon Tower Advisors) - Req
job description:
Description

Job Summary:

Under management supervision, uses knowledge and skills obtained through education and experience to develop and implement sales data analytics, projects and initiatives. Serves as a liaison between Sales channel management and Technology organization by analyzing business issues that require CRM/technology enhancements and providing requirements. Demonstrates attention to detail and professional judgement when making judgements and recommendations based on the analysis of information.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:
  • Understands the structure and general business needs of the organization and recommends data driven solutions that enable the business to achieve goals and improve processes.
  • Creates business requirements documents for implementation of solutions.
  • Assists in building out CRM user interface including form design. Is responsible for some of the creation and maintenance of system views, charts and dashboards.
  • Creates segmentation frameworks to organize sales prospects and clients into groups for more precise and targeted marketing.
  • Utilizes data mining and implements thoughtful segmentation rules to help meaningfully slice target audience.
  • Partners with data analysts to collaborate with sales channel managers and marketing department to provide meaningful data for marketing campaign planning, execution and reporting documents.
  • Develops analysis/reports on the effectiveness of sales and marketing campaigns.
  • Manages deadlines and expectations for projects through regular communication.
  • Performs other duties and responsibilities as assigned.
Qualifications

Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:

Knowledge of:
  • Business knowledge and industry trends with the ability to determine their potential impact upon various clients.
  • Comfort learning basic SQL to support CRM reporting.
Skill in:
  • Organizational, planning and time management skills as well as a "roll up the sleeves" mentality.
  • Strong written, oral communication and interpersonal skills.
Ability to:
  • Interact with management at all levels.
  • Manage time and project work effectively and efficiently.
  • Work in a client-focused and team-based environment.
  • Be a creative thinker and have an entrepreneurial mindset.
  • Work in a dynamic, growing environment.
  • Able to proactively problem-solve; foresees and resolves challenges under pressure
  • Able to identify areas of opportunity and recommend change
Educational/Previous Experience Requirements:
  • Junior or senior standing candidate pursuing Bachelor's or Master's Degree in a business or information systems field.
~or~
  • Any equivalent combination of experience, education and/or training approved by Human Resources.
Licenses/Certifications:
  • None required.
